channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Musk’s Secretive Team Goes on TV, and RFK Jr. Hires a Vaccine Skeptic
item.description: Plus, what we didn’t know about sharks.

item.title: Second federal judge blocks Trump from banning transgender troops in the military: ‘The government’s arguments are not persuasive’
item.description: Thousands of transgender people serve in the military, but they represent less than 1% of the total number of active-duty service members.

item.title: Trump’s executive order puts JD Vance in charge of overseeing efforts to ‘remove improper ideology’ from all areas of the Smithsonian Institution
item.description: The executive order also hints at the return of statues and monuments of Confederate figures.

item.title: ‘Of Course People Are Angry’: Four Columnists Unpack What the Democrats Are Missing
item.description: Why has fighting and opposing Trump proved so hard? It’s not just because Republicans hold all the cards in government.

item.title: U.K. banks may have to pay out billions of pounds over unlawful car loans
item.description: Millions of drivers would become eligible for compensation if the U.K.'s highest judicial authority sides with borrowers.

item.title: Trump tells Rep. Elise Stefanik she has to stay in Congress instead of becoming UN ambassador because the GOP House margin is so thin
item.description: Trump confirmed he was withdrawing the New York Republican's nomination in a Truth Social post, saying that it was “essential that we maintain EVERY R...

item.title: The Self-Deporters
item.description: Our immigration correspondnet has found a surprising trend.

item.title: A former Mars Wrigley executive making $200k a year stole $28 million from the company and bought a multi-million dollar home
item.description: Paul Steed is accused in a federal indictment of stealing more than $28 million from Mars since about 2013 through various schemes.

item.title: Hegseth Seeks to Reassure Allies on First Official Trip to Asia
item.description: At his first stop in the Philippines, the U.S. defense secretary promised to strengthen deterrence against Chinese “threats” in the region. He also pl...

item.title: Ukraine Stages New Push Into Russia, Officials and Experts Say
item.description: The small incursion targets the Belgorod region, according to Ukrainian officials, analysts of open-source intelligence and Russian military bloggers....

item.title: Myanmar Quake Causes Chaos in Bangkok
item.description: In Bangkok, a building that had been under construction collapsed, killing at least three people, while dozens of workers remained stuck in the rubble...

item.title: Maps: 7.7-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Myanmar
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.

item.title: Medieval Tales of Merlin and Arthur, Hidden for Centuries, Return to Light
item.description: Cambridge University researchers found a manuscript with rare Arthurian tales bound into a ledger more than 400 years old and used advanced technology...

item.title: Live Updates: At Least 20 Dead in Myanmar After Strong Earthquake
item.description: The 7.7.-magnitude quake caused havoc across a swath of Southeast Asia. Three deaths were reported in Bangkok, where a skyscraper that was under const...
